newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold trade lively after holiday.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold trade lively after holiday.

text.p: The Istanbul gold exchange attracted brisk trade on Tuesday following a 4-1/2 day religious holiday, dealers said.
Volume jumped to 845 kilos from last Thursday's 115 kilos, which was recorded in one session before the exchange closed at midday for the holiday.
Gold prices ended firmer at $343.70 an ounce and 1,484,600 lira per gram, versus $342.65 and 1,457,200 lira at Thursday's close.
Most of the day's trade -- 665 kilos -- took place in the morning session.
Only 50 kilos of total trade was in dollar terms.
